10:15 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning the type of http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID+Connect/ is pom which looks a bit weird since this is not a supported type: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
10:16 <vmassol> not sure why users would download a pom either btw ;)  
10:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: it is a pom, you are not supposed to install it, it's used as an entry points of OIDC extensions  
10:17 <vmassol> I know but pom type don't exist ATM and we haven't done this strategy of exposing poms so far  
10:17 <vmassol> it raises issues  
10:17 <vmassol> issue 1: pom type don't exist in the filter of the LT  
10:17 <tmortagne> it's not a startegy, just needed an entry point to I important the parent  
10:17 <tmortagne> I will just make it not expose the download button  
10:17 <vmassol> issue 2: users will not undestand what to do with the pom download  
10:17 <vmassol> issue 3: it creates too many entries in the LT  
10:17 <tmortagne> s/important/imported/  
10:18 <vmassol> issue 4: we haven't used that for other extensions  
10:18 <vmassol> (so it's inconsistent ATM)  
10:18 <vmassol> we said in the past  
10:18 <vmassol> that we would use the pom type when we support hierarchies in the LT  
10:18 <vmassol> so that you can expand a node  
10:19 <vmassol> but right now it's flat so it'll create issue 3  
10:19 <vmassol> basically when you see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.creationDate&d=desc&name=openid you don't know how they are related  
10:20 <vmassol> I'm not against starting to use pom but we need to agree about it to also do it for other modules and fix a few things  
10:21 <vmassol> issue 1 should be easy to fix but I fear that users may not understand what "pom" type means  
10:21 <vmassol> (easy to fix by creating a new type page)  
10:21 <vmassol> maybe we can call it "Parent" or something like this, don't know if it's clearer  
10:22 <tmortagne> I don't like too much making pom always parents  
10:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <tmortagne> what would make more sense in this case is add a "Project" type and use that as the entry point for several extensions that are part of the same project which is the case here and for many contribs (or not) as well  
10:25 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <tmortagne> you don't always need that but in this case I needed to write a few things about OIDC in general etc  
10:25 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <vmassol> yes I undertand, I've had several like these in the past too  
10:37 <vmassol> but I always ended up writing docs in the actualy extensions used by the user  
10:37 <vmassol> (I think it was clearer for the iuser)  
10:37 <vmassol> \*user  
10:40 <tmortagne> I don't really have any extension more user oriented than the other in this case  
10:43 <vmassol> yes your issue is that the 2 extenions are at the same level… you don't have a UI one that would offer admin UI optiobns? :)  
10:43 <vmassol> \*options  
10:43 <vmassol> well even if you had you'd probaby have 2 anyway  
10:43 <vmassol> since these extensions have to be installed in 2 different wikis  
10:43 <vmassol> so won't work...  
10:43 <vmassol> indeed your case is a bit special  
10:47 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <tmortagne> there is a bit if UI (even if not the kind of UI you go to explicitly) and there will be configuration UI at some point probably but yes won't really make one more important than the other  
10:50 <vmassol> replied to your mail thomas  
10:50 <vmassol> for category I'd put "Others"  
11:48 <vmassol> hmm the AS is strange tmortagne: it says you created some radeox pages that I renamed (see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News) I guess this is because of the copy bug that keeps the author  
11:49 <vmassol> it's funny: you supposedly created the pages but it's me who deleted them (rename=copy/delete)

14:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: we need to introduce events for copy and move so that AS store more meaningful activity in a case like this (plus we need those events for other use cases anyway)  
14:12 <tmortagne> does anyone still have anything blocker for 8.2M1 ?  
14:13 <tmortagne> ci.xwiki.org looks ok enough so I will start the release ASAP  
14:14 <tmortagne> vmassol: you have some missing documentation  
14:14 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%228.2-milestone-1%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Fixed%22%29%20and%20%28%28Documentation%20is%20EMPTY%29%20or%20%28%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY%29%29  
14:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: sure, but there's still a problem with copy. It says that you created the page but I don't understand why: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Old+XWiki+1.0+syntax+renderer/Chart+Macro+%28Radeox%29?viewer=history&showminor=false&firstIndex=0  
14:15 <vmassol> you were not even the creator of the page. You were just the last one to make modifications to it  
14:15 <vmassol> checking doc  
14:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: I guess AS mistakenly look at the page author instead of page creator when receiving DocumentCreatedEvent  
14:17 <tmortagne> vmassol: did you created http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki82M1/ as a space on purpose ?  
14:17 <vmassol> yes  
14:17 <tmortagne> should we create release notes that way now ?  
14:18 <vmassol> my take is that we should create all pages like this by default  
14:18 <tmortagne> it's the first one AFAIK  
14:18 <vmassol> ope  
14:18 <vmassol> nope  
14:18 <vmassol> not the first one  
14:18 <vmassol> I've been doing this since NS as introduced on xwiki.org  
14:18 <vmassol> s/as/was  
14:18 <vmassol> since it's the default  
14:18 <vmassol> (so I've been using the default)  
14:18 <tmortagne> it's the first release note  
14:18 <tmortagne> not the first page  
14:18 <vmassol> nope  
14:18 <vmassol> I created other RN like this  
14:18 <vmassol> I even modified the release app code to support it a while back ;)  
14:19 <tmortagne> could not find it, 8.1 is a final page  
14:19 <vmassol> s/release app/release plan app  
14:20 <vmassol> for ex http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki743/  
14:21 <vmassol> anyway we need to decide  
14:21 <vmassol> but I think it's best to use the default  
14:21 <vmassol> ie to create NP by default  
14:21 <vmassol> wdyt?  
14:24 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <tmortagne> sure we need to decide and I'm fine with nested page but it was the RN I saw like this and I did not see any mail about it

I don't consider this jira extension id change to be a major change that's worth being on the summary page
